column4: i am running the ubuntu live cd to test if my soundcard works and it wasn't autodetected. lspci says it's a Creative Labs SB Live. every time i try to play a sound file i get an error message. can someone help?
that's probably just a livecd issue. I have it with the livecd, but it works fine when you install it.
ok.....so if i install and it doesn't work, can i come back and get help?
i need an ftp client to upload all my old settings to my server
ubuntu doesn't use 'root' but emulates it with sudo. the password you're looking for is 'ubuntu'
sudo apt-get update fails and apt-get install gftp dies telling me to apt-get update....
nvm...i'll do it from mepis....be back in a sec to talk....
so is this going to take a kernel recompile? because i tend to recompile with the latest version anyhow.....
what where you talking about exactly?
it'll work out of the box, promise
next time i sign on. i'll be in ubuntu!
